title: Mohsin Naqvi extends congratulations on U.S. Independence Day
content:
ISLAMABAD, Jul 04 (APP): Federal Interior Minister Mohsin Naqvi has extended heartfelt congratulations to the American people, Acting U.S. Ambassador Natalie Baker, and the U.S. diplomatic staff on the occasion of the United States’ Independence Day.
In his message, the minister conveyed best wishes to the U.S. government and its people, saying, “We share in the joy of the American people on this important day.”
He added, “The 4th of July symbolizes the spirit of sacrifice and the greatness of democracy. Freedom is a symbol of identity, sovereignty, and human dignity.”
Praising U.S. leadership, Naqvi remarked, “Under President Donald Trump’s leadership, the U.S. has progressed on the path of development, unity, and peace. His role in promoting global peace has been exemplary.”
Expressing optimism, he said, “We hope that longstanding international conflicts will move toward resolution during President Trump’s tenure.”
He also acknowledged Trump’s role during Indo-Pak tensions, calling it “balanced, insightful, and wise,” and said his constructive engagement will always be remembered.
Naqvi noted that “the historic luncheon hosted by President Trump at the White House in honour of Field Marshal Syed Asim Munir marked a new chapter in Pakistan-U.S. relations.”
He emphasized that bilateral cooperation strengthened during periods of regional tension and credited Washington’s balanced approach for enhancing mutual trust and dignity.
Concluding his message, Naqvi said, “The 4th of July is a day of renewed determination, courage, and unity for the American people. I pray that this 249th U.S. Independence Day becomes a new message of justice, freedom, and peace for the world.”
